intro: Spergula canadensis, commonly known as Canadian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer. Spergula canadensis is known for its ecological value, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for various herbivorous insects.
